description: Number of walks on cubic lattice.
references: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: Jeremy Gardiner, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..999
R. K. Guy, Catwalks, sandsteps and Pascal pyramids, J. Integer Sequences, Vol. 3 (2000), Article #00.1.6 (see figure 7).
Simon Plouffe, Approximations de séries génératrices et quelques conjectures, Dissertation, Université du Québec à Montréal, 1992.
Simon Plouffe, 1031 Generating Functions and Conjectures, Université du Québec à Montréal, 1992.
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (3,-3,1).
formula: a(n) = 8*n^2 + 9*n.G.f.: (17-x)/(1-x)^3. _Simon Plouffe_ in his 1992 dissertation.a(n) = 16 * A000217(n) + n. - _Jon Perry_, Nov 05 2014
mathematica: CoefficientList[Series[(17 - x) / (1 - x)^3, {x, 0, 40}], x] (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Nov 05 2014 *)
prog: (PARI) Vec((17-x)/(1-x)^3 + O(x^50)) \\ _Michel Marcus_, Nov 05 2014(MAGMA) [8*n^2 + 9*n : n in [1..40]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Nov 05 2014
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
extensions: Formula and more terms from _Jeffrey Shallit_, Aug 15 1995
